entry.title: Goods Vehicles (Testing) (Fees) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2002
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Goods Vehicles (Testing) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1995 by increasing the fees as follows—

entry.title: The Adoption (Intercountry Aspects) Act (Northern Ireland) 2001 (Commencement No. 3) Order (Northern Ireland) 2002
entry.summary: This Order brings into operation on 22nd February 2002 the remaining provisions of the Adoption (Intercountry Aspects) Act (Northern Ireland) 2001 not already in operation.

entry.title: Motor Vehicle Testing (Amendment) (Fees) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2002
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Motor Vehicle Testing Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1995 by increasing the fees payable for examinations and re-examinations as follows—

entry.title: The Local Government (Best Value) Performance Plans and Reviews Amendment and Specified Dates Order 2002
entry.summary: This Order amends the Local Government (Best Value) Performance Plans and Reviews Order 1999 (the 1999 Order). That Order specifies the matters which best value authorities must include in their performance plans. It also specifies matters that should be included in their performance reviews and the time period in which all of their reviews should be carried out.

entry.title: Foot-and-Mouth Disease (Controlled Area) Order (Northern Ireland) 2002
entry.summary: This Order repeals and replaces the Foot-and-Mouth Disease (Controlled Area) (No. 6) Order (Northern Ireland) 2001 which imposed, with variations and exceptions, the restrictions contained in Part III of the Foot-and-Mouth Disease Order (Northern Ireland) 1962 in Northern Ireland.

title.div: The Non-Domestic Rating (Rural Rate Relief) (Wales) Order 2002 / Gorchymyn Ardrethu Annomestig (Rhyddhad Ardrethi Gwledig) (Cymru) 2002

div.p: Each county and county borough council in Wales (“billing authority”) is required by section 42A of the Local Government Finance Act 1988 (“the Act”) to compile and maintain for each chargeable financial year a list (“rural settlement list”) which identifies settlements which are wholly or partly within the authority’s area, appear to the authority to have had a population of not more than 3,000 on the 31st December immediately preceding the beginning of the chargeable financial year in question and are in that financial year wholly or partly within an area designated by order as a rural area for the purposes of the section.

O dan adran 42A o Ddeddf Cyllid Llywodraeth Leol 1998 (“y Ddeddf”), mae'n ofynnol i bob cyngor sir a phob cyngor bwrdeistref sirol yng Nghymru (“awdurdod bilio”) lunio a chadw rhestr ar gyfer pob blwyddyn daladwy (“rhestr aneddiadau gwledig”) sy'n enwi'r aneddiadau gwledig sydd yn gyfan gwbl neu yn rhannol o fewn ardal yr awdurdod, ac sydd ym marn yr awdurdod heb boblogaeth o fwy na 3,000 ar 31 Rhagfyr yn union cyn dechrau'r flwyddyn ariannol daladwy o dan sylw ac sydd yn y flwyddyn ariannol honno yn gyfan gwbl neu'n rhannol o fewn ardal sydd wedi'i dynodi'n ardal wledig at ddibenion yr adran.

entry.title: The M25 Motorway (Heathrow Terminal 5 Access) (No1) Connecting Roads Scheme 2002
entry.summary: This version of the The M25 Motorway (Heathrow Terminal 5 Access) (No1) Connecting Roads Scheme 2002 is published under the authority and superintendence of the Queen's Printer of Acts of Parliament and Controller of HMSO. It has been prepared to reflect the text as it was Made.

title.div: The General Teaching Council for Wales (Fees) Regulations 2002 / Rheoliadau Cyngor Addysgu Cyffredinol Cymru (Ffioedd) 2002

div.p: The General Teaching Council for Wales (Functions) Regulations 2000, made under section 4(4) of the Teaching and Higher Education Act 1998, enable the General Teaching Council for Wales to charge a fee for the registration and retention of entries on the Register of teachers which they have established under that Act.

Mae Rheoliadau Cyngor Addysgu Cyffredinol Cymru (Swyddogaethau) 2000, a wnaed o dan adran 4(4) o Ddeddf Addysgu ac Addysg Uwch 1998, yn galluogi Cyngor Addysgu Cyffredinol Cymru i godi ffi am gofrestru a chadw cofnodion athrawon ac athrawesau ar y Gofrestr y maent wedi'i sefydlu o dan y Ddeddf honno.

entry.title: The Notification of Marketing of Food for Particular Nutritional Uses (England and Wales) Regulations 2002
entry.summary: These Regulations implement for England and Wales Article 9 of Council Directive 89/398/EEC on the approximation of the laws of the Member States relating to foodstuffs intended for particular nutritional uses, as amended by Directive 1999/41/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council.

entry.title: The Social Security (Contributions) (Amendment No. 2) Regulations 2002
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Social Security (Contributions) Regulations 2001 (S.I. 2001/1004) (“the principal Regulations”).

entry.title: The Electronic Signatures Regulations 2002
entry.summary: These Regulations implement Directive 1999/93/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council on a Community framework for electronic signatures. The provisions of this Directive which are implemented relate to the supervision of certification-service-providers, their liability in certain circumstances and data protection requirements concerning them; provisions in the Directive relating to the admissibility of electronic signatures as evidence in legal proceedings were implemented by section 7 of the Electronic Communications Act 2000 (2000 c. 7).

title.div: The Miscellaneous Food Additives (Amendment) (Wales) Regulations 2002 / Rheoliadau Ychwanegion Bwyd Amrywiol (Diwygio) (Cymru) 2002

div.p: These Regulations, which apply to Wales only, amend the Miscellaneous Food Additives Regulations 1995, as already amended (“the principal Regulations”), which extend to Great Britain.
Mae'r Rheoliadau hyn, sy'n gymwys i Gymru yn unig, yn diwygio Rheoliadau Ychwanegion Bwyd Amrywiol 1995, fel y'u diwygiwyd eisoes (“y prif Reoliadau”) sy'n gymwys i Brydain Fawr.

title.div: The Sweeteners in Food (Amendment) (Wales) Regulations 2002 / Rheoliadau Melysyddion mewn Bwyd (Diwygio) (Cymru) 2002

div.p: These Regulations, which extend to Wales only, further amend the Sweeteners in Food Regulations 1995 (S.I. 1995/3123 as already amended) which extend to Great Britain, by—

Mae'r Rheoliadau hyn, sy'n gymwys i Gymru yn unig, yn diwygio ymhellach ar Reoliadau Melysyddion mewn Bwyd 1995 (O.S. 1995/3123 fel y'i diwygiwyd eisoes) sy'n gymwys i Brydain Fawr, drwy wneud y canlynol—

entry.title: The Sea Fish (Prohibited Methods of Fishing) (Firth of Clyde) Order 2002
entry.summary: This Order prohibits, subject to certain exceptions, all methods of fishing within certain areas of the Firth of Clyde. A map showing the areas closed to fishing under this Order is appended to this note for illustrative purposes only. The Order remains in force until 0000 hours on the 30th April 2002 (article 1(2)).

entry.title: The Pitcairn Court of Appeal Order 2000 (Amendment) Order 2002
entry.summary: This Order removes inappropriate language from the form of Judicial affirmation in the Pitcairn Court of Appeal Order 2000.

entry.title: The Export of Goods (Federal Republic of Yugoslavia) (Control) (Revocation) Order 2002
entry.summary: This Order revokes the Export of Goods (Federal Republic of Yugoslavia) (Control) Order 1998 which prohibited the exportation of any goods specified in the Annex to Council Regulation (EC) No. 926/98 (OJ No. L 130, 1.5.1998, p.1.) to any destination in the Federal Republic of Yugoslavia. Council Regulation (EC) No 2156/2001 of 5 November 2001 (OJ No. L 289, of 6.11.2001, p.5) removed the prohibition on the sale or supply to the Federal Republic of Yugoslavia of equipment which might be used for internal repression or terrorism and repealed Council Regulation (EC) No 926/98.

entry.title: The Education (Chief Inspector of Schools in England) Order 2002
entry.summary: This Order appoints David Robert Bell to be Her Majesty’s Chief Inspector of Schools in England for the period from 1st May 2002 to 30th April 2007.

entry.title: The Al-Qa'ida and Taliban (United Nations Measures) (Amendment) Order 2002
entry.summary: This Order, made under the United Nations Act 1946, amends the Al-Qa'ida and Taliban (United Nations Measures) Order 2002 to correct a drafting error.

entry.title: The Education (Chief Inspector of Education and Training in Wales) Order 2002
entry.summary: This Order re-appoints Susan Lewis to be Her Majesty’s Chief Inspector of Education and Training in Wales for a further period of five years from 1st June 2002. Her present appointment under the Education (Chief Inspector of Schools in Wales) Order 1997 ends on 31st May 2002. That Order is revoked by the present Order.

entry.title: The Scottish Social Services Council (Appointments, Procedure and Access to the Register) Amendment Regulations 2002
entry.summary: This version of the The Scottish Social Services Council (Appointments, Procedure and Access to the Register) Amendment Regulations 2002 is the published under the authority and superintendence of the Queen's Printer for Scotland. It has been prepared to reflect the text as it was Made.
